title: Gaze-Based Modeling Training Program for Perceptual Task Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced learners requiring foundational understanding of biomechanical principles in biology
context.additional_context: Hybrid education combining smartphone-based learning and offline practice in limited technology environments. Project-based assessment to verify real-world task application capabilities

learning_goals: Learners can identify key visual features of fish movement patterns in videos with 85% accuracy using the EMME technique
Learners can apply trained gaze strategies to new fish species to classify movement types with over 70% accuracy
Learners can effectively regulate attention focus areas during visual search processes to reduce analysis time by 20%

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
